Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh and Sri Lanka have a history of tension, stemming from the 'Naagin dance' incident in 2018.
Sri Lanka and Bangladesh have both struggled in T20 matches recently, with Sri Lanka losing 10 of their last 14 T20 matches and Bangladesh losing 14 of their last 16 completed games.
These teams are evenly matched with Sri Lanka having better spinners and Bangladesh having a more experienced seam attack.
Kusal Mendis is auditioning to play as an opener for Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup in October.
Mahedi Hasan has the best economy rate in world cricket among bowlers who have played at least 25 innings.
Bangladesh might change their opening pair and revisit their bowling attack.
Sri Lanka might bring Ashen Bandara into the middle order or move Danushka Gunathilaka back up to the top of the order.
Sri Lanka have won eight of the 12 completed matches between these teams, but lost two of the last three.
Bangladesh team director Khaled Mahmud hopes the openers can bat to a plan and show intent.
